title: Upgrade Any IKEA Furniture With These Ingenious Hacks
description: Give new life to your overlooked IKEA furniture with quick, budget-friendly upgrades that make a big impact. These clever hacks let you add personal flair to your space while transforming items that may have lost their charm or no longer suit your style. From bold makeovers to subtle tweaks, these creative projects prove that everyday […] You're reading Upgrade Any IKEA Furniture With These Ingenious Hacks, originally posted on Decoist. If you enjoyed this post, be sure to follow Decoist on Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest.
author: Sherry Nothingam
excerpt: Discover brilliant IKEA hacks that turn basic pieces into stunning storage solutions, playful spaces, and chic decor upgrades.
text: Give new life to your overlooked IKEA furniture with quick, budget-friendly upgrades that make a big impact. These clever hacks let you add personal flair to your space while transforming items that may have lost their charm or no longer suit your style. From bold makeovers to subtle tweaks, these creative projects prove that everyday pieces can be beautifully repurposed for a high-end look. Whether you’re looking to turn this into a DIY side hustle or just a fun hobby, these imaginative ideas offer endless possibilities. 1. Transform IKEA Shoe Holder Into Bathroom Storage Photo Credit: Pinterest Repurpose an IKEA shoe holder into sleek bathroom storage. Its slim design fits tight spaces, like beside a vanity or behind doors. With a few tools and brackets, this shoe holder easily converts into shelves for towels, toilet paper, and more—maximizing storage with minimal effort and cost. 2. Create a Chic Shoe Display Photo Credit: Pinterest Elevate your shoe storage by turning basic IKEA shelves into a fashionable display. Add wall art, a fresh coat of paint, and accent lighting for a chic showroom feel. Include a cozy rug, pillows, and patterned wallpaper for a stylish, luxurious retreat for your designer shoes. 3. Build DIY Floating Shelves Photo Credit: Pinterest Turn IKEA shelves into floating wall units with ease. Measure your wall space, secure the mounts, and attach the shelves. This straightforward IKEA hack adds sleek, modern storage and a visually appealing floating effect to your room. 4. Craft a Kid’s Grocery Store with IKEA Shelves Photo Credit: Pinterest Turn IKEA Kallax shelves and PVC pipes into a fun grocery store for kids. Add a fabric awning, paint, and shelves stocked with cleaned recyclable containers. This setup provides hours of creative play without breaking the bank. 5. Transform IKEA Tarva Dressers for a Vintage Look Photo Credit: Pinterest Give IKEA Tarva dressers a vintage twist with paint, unique drawer knobs, and textured fabric accents. With a little DIY flair, create a vintage-inspired dresser that’s both stylish and budget-friendly. 6. Repurpose IKEA Bag Dispensers for Storage Photo Credit: Pinterest Turn IKEA bag dispensers into stackable storage for toys, crafts, or household items. Customize them with paint or decorative paper, transforming them into functional and stylish storage. 7. Create a Mini Indoor Greenhouse with IKEA Cabinets Photo Credit: Reddit Use an IKEA RUDSTA cabinet to create an indoor greenhouse. Remove the doors, add ventilation, and place a UV light inside. Plant seeds or add small plants, mist daily, and enjoy an easy-to-maintain greenhouse year-round. 8. DIY Fluffy IKEA Stools Photo Credit: Pinterest Transform an IKEA stool into a plush, comfy seat by adding a fluffy couch cushion with adhesive. This budget-friendly hack creates a stylish, cozy stool perfect for any room. 9. Convert Shelf Brackets into Decorative Bookends Photo Credit: Pinterest Flip IKEA shelf brackets upside down to create shelves with built-in bookends. Customize them with paint or stain for a personal touch, making them an easy yet stylish addition to any room. 10. Create a Built-In Look with Billy Bookcases Photo Credit: Pinterest Convert IKEA Billy Bookcases into a built-in unit. Assemble the bookcases, secure them together, and add baseboards and trim for a polished, custom look in any living space. 11. Hang Wicker Baskets for Wall Storage Photo Credit: Pinterest Mount wicker baskets on walls to create a charming storage solution. Secure with screws or adhesive, and use these baskets to store essentials like books, toys, or bathroom items—adding both storage and style to any room. 12. Hang IKEA Stockholm Mirrors with Belts Photo Credit: Pinterest Use two belts to hang IKEA Stockholm mirrors for a chic, unique look. Secure the belts to the wall with screws, and place the mirror for a creative, on-trend mirror display. 13. DIY Pegboard Organizers for Bathroom Walls Photo Credit: Pinterest Convert IKEA pegboards into versatile bathroom organizers by adding hooks and baskets. Customize the layout to store toiletries, towels, or decorative accents. This hack combines functionality with endless customization. 14. Build a Lemonade Stand with IKEA Crates Photo Credit: Pinterest Create a playful lemonade stand by stacking and painting IKEA wooden crates. Arrange them to form the stand, decorate them with fun colors, and add a sign. This imaginative project is a hit for kids’ playtime. 15. Repurpose IKEA Bread Boxes as Nightstands Photo Credit: Pinterest Turn IKEA bread boxes into nightstands or end tables by removing the lids and adding a drawer. Finish with paint or a glass top for a stylish, rustic accent piece that doubles as practical storage. 16. Turn Toilet Roll Holders into Wall Hooks Photo Credit: Pinterest Repurpose IKEA toilet roll holders to hang clothing, keys, or small decor items. This lightweight, affordable hack keeps your space tidy without taking up much room. 17. Use a Towel Rack as a Versatile Wall Organizer Photo Credit: Pinterest Mount a towel rack on any wall to hold calendars, kids’ artwork, or important documents. This DIY wall organizer keeps essentials organized and off the counter. 18. Use Utensil Holders for Toilet Paper Storage Photo Credit: Pinterest IKEA utensil holders make creative, space-saving toilet paper holders. Mount them on the wall, add rolls, and enjoy a unique, practical bathroom storage solution. 19. Create a Green Oasis with IKEA End Tables Photo Credit: Pinterest Cut an opening in an IKEA end table to fit a plant pot, creating a mini indoor garden. Paint or decorate the table to match your decor, and enjoy a stylish, space-efficient way to display greenery. 20. Transform a Table into a Play Kitchen Photo Credit: Pinterest Convert an old IKEA table into a toy stove with a bit of creativity. Add drawer knobs for dials and paint circles for burners, creating an adorable play kitchen for little ones. html:
Give new life to your overlooked IKEA furniture with quick, budget-friendly upgrades that make a big impact. These clever hacks let you add personal flair to your space while transforming items that may have lost their charm or no longer suit your style.

From bold makeovers to subtle tweaks, these creative projects prove that everyday pieces can be beautifully repurposed for a high-end look. Whether you’re looking to turn this into a DIY side hustle or just a fun hobby, these imaginative ideas offer endless possibilities.

1. Transform IKEA Shoe Holder Into Bathroom Storage

Repurpose an IKEA shoe holder into sleek bathroom storage. Its slim design fits tight spaces, like beside a vanity or behind doors. With a few tools and brackets, this shoe holder easily converts into shelves for towels, toilet paper, and more—maximizing storage with minimal effort and cost.

2. Create a Chic Shoe Display

Elevate your shoe storage by turning basic IKEA shelves into a fashionable display. Add wall art, a fresh coat of paint, and accent lighting for a chic showroom feel. Include a cozy rug, pillows, and patterned wallpaper for a stylish, luxurious retreat for your designer shoes.

3. Build DIY Floating Shelves

Turn IKEA shelves into floating wall units with ease. Measure your wall space, secure the mounts, and attach the shelves. This straightforward IKEA hack adds sleek, modern storage and a visually appealing floating effect to your room.

4. Craft a Kid’s Grocery Store with IKEA Shelves

Turn IKEA Kallax shelves and PVC pipes into a fun grocery store for kids. Add a fabric awning, paint, and shelves stocked with cleaned recyclable containers. This setup provides hours of creative play without breaking the bank.

5. Transform IKEA Tarva Dressers for a Vintage Look

Give IKEA Tarva dressers a vintage twist with paint, unique drawer knobs, and textured fabric accents. With a little DIY flair, create a vintage-inspired dresser that’s both stylish and budget-friendly.

6. Repurpose IKEA Bag Dispensers for Storage

Turn IKEA bag dispensers into stackable storage for toys, crafts, or household items. Customize them with paint or decorative paper, transforming them into functional and stylish storage.

7. Create a Mini Indoor Greenhouse with IKEA Cabinets

Use an IKEA RUDSTA cabinet to create an indoor greenhouse. Remove the doors, add ventilation, and place a UV light inside. Plant seeds or add small plants, mist daily, and enjoy an easy-to-maintain greenhouse year-round.

8. DIY Fluffy IKEA Stools

Transform an IKEA stool into a plush, comfy seat by adding a fluffy couch cushion with adhesive. This budget-friendly hack creates a stylish, cozy stool perfect for any room.

9. Convert Shelf Brackets into Decorative Bookends

Flip IKEA shelf brackets upside down to create shelves with built-in bookends. Customize them with paint or stain for a personal touch, making them an easy yet stylish addition to any room.

10. Create a Built-In Look with Billy Bookcases

Convert IKEA Billy Bookcases into a built-in unit. Assemble the bookcases, secure them together, and add baseboards and trim for a polished, custom look in any living space.

11. Hang Wicker Baskets for Wall Storage

Mount wicker baskets on walls to create a charming storage solution. Secure with screws or adhesive, and use these baskets to store essentials like books, toys, or bathroom items—adding both storage and style to any room.

12. Hang IKEA Stockholm Mirrors with Belts

Use two belts to hang IKEA Stockholm mirrors for a chic, unique look. Secure the belts to the wall with screws, and place the mirror for a creative, on-trend mirror display.

13. DIY Pegboard Organizers for Bathroom Walls

Convert IKEA pegboards into versatile bathroom organizers by adding hooks and baskets. Customize the layout to store toiletries, towels, or decorative accents. This hack combines functionality with endless customization.

14. Build a Lemonade Stand with IKEA Crates

Create a playful lemonade stand by stacking and painting IKEA wooden crates. Arrange them to form the stand, decorate them with fun colors, and add a sign. This imaginative project is a hit for kids’ playtime.

15. Repurpose IKEA Bread Boxes as Nightstands

Turn IKEA bread boxes into nightstands or end tables by removing the lids and adding a drawer. Finish with paint or a glass top for a stylish, rustic accent piece that doubles as practical storage.

16. Turn Toilet Roll Holders into Wall Hooks

Repurpose IKEA toilet roll holders to hang clothing, keys, or small decor items. This lightweight, affordable hack keeps your space tidy without taking up much room.

17. Use a Towel Rack as a Versatile Wall Organizer

Mount a towel rack on any wall to hold calendars, kids’ artwork, or important documents. This DIY wall organizer keeps essentials organized and off the counter.

18. Use Utensil Holders for Toilet Paper Storage

IKEA utensil holders make creative, space-saving toilet paper holders. Mount them on the wall, add rolls, and enjoy a unique, practical bathroom storage solution.

19. Create a Green Oasis with IKEA End Tables

Cut an opening in an IKEA end table to fit a plant pot, creating a mini indoor garden. Paint or decorate the table to match your decor, and enjoy a stylish, space-efficient way to display greenery.

20. Transform a Table into a Play Kitchen

Convert an old IKEA table into a toy stove with a bit of creativity. Add drawer knobs for dials and paint circles for burners, creating an adorable play kitchen for little ones.

Related Articles

  • Perfect Finds for Your Furry Friends — IKEA’s New Pet Collection
  • Ikea Launches TESAMMANS Range, A New Collaboration with Raw Color
  • How to Paint IKEA Furniture with Flawless Results

Each of these creative IKEA hacks brings style, functionality, and personalized flair to your home, whether you’re looking to maximize space, create playful setups, or simply elevate everyday items with a unique twist.
